bioghist.p: Gordon Alexander Block, Jr. (1885-1964) was a Philadelphia lawyer. He received his law degree from the University of Pennsylvania and was admitted to the bar in 1906. He was a member of the firm Stern & Wolf (later Wolf, Block, Schorr and Solis-Cohen). Block was an avid collection of Lincoln memorabilia.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of ephemera, photographs artifacts, and other materials related to Abraham Lincoln. Materials include: many artifacts, including busts, mugs, a pipe, and plates; prints, photographs and engravings of Lincoln and various artistic depictions of Lincoln (a few contemporary prints, but mostly later); ephemera and printed materials about Lincoln, including broadsides, postcards, tickets, and pamphlets; tickets from Lincoln receptions; a photograph album with photos of Lincoln sites in Kentucky and Illinois; a printing plate for a commemorative edition of the Gettysburg Address; sheet music; a wood block for portrait of Lincoln by Timothy Cole; and miscellaneous letters and reproductions of letters to or from Lincoln. The collection also includes a certificate given to Gordon Block for 50 years of service in the Philadelphia Bar Association.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
